data.title: Cougar Line
data.meta_description: Cougar Line Shuttles information, shuttle tracking, ridesystems app and more.
data.text:
Go to the tracking maps, then click on the button for each route to see where the buses stop.

North Route

Days of Operation: Monday-Friday

Hours of Operation: 7 a.m.-7 p.m.

Shuttle Stops: Fleming, PGH, MSM, Entrance 18, Elgin-East, Law-East, Bauer-South, Student Center, CPH/Library, UH Technology Bridge, Bauer-North, Law-West, Elgin-West. Zone A, Alumni Center

Student Center/Zone D Route

Days of Operation: Monday-Friday

Hours of Operation: 7 a.m.-7 p.m.

Shuttle Stops: Student Center, CPH/Library, Rec Center-South, Cougar Village/Moody Towers, DART Center, Zone D, College of Medicine, Rec Center-North

PGH/Zone E Route

Days of Operation: Monday-Friday

Hours of Operation: 7 a.m.-7 p.m.

Shuttle Stops: Fleming, PGH, Stadium-South, Cambridge Oaks-South, Cullen Oaks-South, Zone E/8A, Zone E/9C, Cambridge Oaks-North, Quad, Stadium-North

Sugar Land Route

Days of Operation: Monday-Friday

Shuttle Stops: Student Center South / Technology Building at UH at Sugar Land

Hours of Operation: 7 a.m.-10 p.m. Monday-Thursday; 7 a.m.-7 p.m. Fridays

Service: A one-way trip is approximately 40 minutes. The bus will remain at each stop five minutes before departing. All buses are ADA accessible.

Permit Required: A shuttle permit is required in order to ride the Sugar Land route. Those who do not have a shuttle permit will not be allowed to board the shuttle bus.

Please note: The Sugar Land shuttle is intended for students who attend classes at both the main campus and in Sugar Land.It is not an alternative for students who live in Fort Bend County and the Sugar Land area to commute to campus.

PLEASE NOTE: Shuttle permit holders must have their digital Cougar Card readily available for scanning prior to boarding. Physical Cougar Cards are not accepted.

Do the following before boarding:

Make sure you are logged in to the UH Go app

Click on the image of your Cougar Card

Click where it says "Tap for QR Code"

Show the QR Code to the bus driver or other parking representative so they can scan it and verify you have a shuttle permit.

Cougar Trax Shuttle Tracking

Cougar Trax is a real-time GPS tracking system designed to show you when the next UH shuttle will be at a specific shuttle stop. Access Cougar Trax on the website or through the UH Go app.

Charter Requests

Please complete the charter request form at this link

Email completed requests to parking@uh.edu

Charters are first come first served and based strictly on availability

Requests must be submitted ten working days in advance

Charters have a four-hour minimum and rates are (subject to change every January)

$125.49 per hour for UH Departments and no contract is required

$143.41 for unaffiliated requests and contracts will be required. Unaffiliated requests must be submitted 30 calendar days in advance to complete the contract process

Requests submitted late will be charged a 20% rush fee

Estimates will include 30 minutes for Before Operations and 30 minutes after for Post Operations inspections mandated by federal transportation laws

Both 14 seat and 36 seat shuttles are available at the same rate structure above

Requests for 36 or more passengers should state if more than one shuttle is requested, or if one shuttle is requested to make multiple trips

All shuttles are ADA equipped

Once PTS receives the request:

Requestor will be sent an estimate for approval

Requestor will approve the estimate

PTS will schedule the charter

Once the charter is complete, PTS will send an invoice to the requestor to be sent to the department DBA for payment by SC Voucher

Unaffiliated requests must be paid before the charter date and agree to pay for any overages

Requestors agree to pay 50% of the invoice if the charter is cancelled within 3 working days of the charter date

Requestors agree to pay 100% for same day cancellations

Advertise With Us

Advertising space on the shuttle buses is rented on a monthly basis. Learn more.

Lost and Found

For lost and found inquiries, please email parking@uh.edu.
